Eclipse does not ship with the JCOP tools plug-in. The JCOP tools group needs to
be contacted so they can address any issues.

The porting guide contains information for plug-in developers.
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/porting/eclipse_3_0_porting_guide.html

Let them know to open a new bug report if the porting guide does not cover a
scenerio that they encounter.

Thanks.

I'm not sure if this is a problem with plugin. 

There are similar issue been reported in eclipse.platform newsgroup. Can you
please clarify if this is anyhow related to the plugin porting.


-------- Original Message --------
Subject: New class sharing errors in M9
Date: Mon, 24 May 2004 20:43:53 +0000 (UTC)
From: stephen.goldbaum@lehman.com (Stephen Goldbaum)
Organization: http://news.eclipse.org
Newsgroups: eclipse.platform

After switching from M8 to M9, I get exceptions about not being able to
load certain classes exported from other plugins.  I've triple-checked the
plugin.xml files (I'm not using MANIFEST.MF) and everything seems to be
configured correctly.

It seems that the problem occurs given the following situation:
Bundle A - contains an interface IService.
Bundle B - contains an implementation of IService and a  factory to create
and register it with the BundleContext supplied by it's caller (in this
case  Bundle C).
Bundle C - contains the Plugin that calls the factory in Bundle B, passing
its BundleContext.

B's plugin.xml states it dependes on A.
C's plugin.xml states it dependes on B and A.

As far as I can tell, this should be legal and should work.  However, I
get an exception in BundleContextImpl complaining that the packageAdmin
cannot find the class IService when it calls the factory's method (line
598).  Oddly, if I register another instance of IService directly from C,
the call to B's factory works fine.

So, does anyone have an idea what's going on?

Thanks,
Stephen

Created an attachment (id=11079)
plugin.xml that the converter fails with

I've tried the JCOP plugins and have recreated the problem.  The
PluginConverter seems to be having problems converting the attached
plugins.xml.  I'm not sure why it is not working.  The resulting bundle
manifest file does not include any of the runtime libraries specified in the
plugin.xml (no Bundle-ClassPath header is generated).  Notice that the runtime
tag for the plugin.xml is at the end of the file.  Not sure if that is causing
our parser some problems.  Anyway, if no Bundle-ClassPath is generated then we
will not be able to load any classes out of the plugin.

moving to Pascal.  We should not bail as soon as we see the <extension> or 
<extension-point> tags.

Fixed in HEAD. We were never popping out of the stateStack when exiting the
extension or extension point sections.

Great job! Thank you guys for looking on this issue.

Is it going to be included into next nightly builds? Can you please tell me
which package/plugin should I update? Thanks in advance.
This should be in all the build > I20040525-2000

You need to update osgi.
Note that you probably want to delete your config folder.
